title: League of Legends Alpha Client- Not Opening From Desktop, or anywhere for the matter.

replies.body:
Have you tried launching from the shortcut inside your installation folder? It should be in the following directory:

> **(C:\Riot Games\League of Legends)**

It should be either the Lol Client or the lol.admin.launcher.exe file. Try either and let me know if it worked.

> [{quoted}](name=Targons Blade,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=sqcNJ7Qt,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2016-11-15T05:41:00.969+0000)
>
> Have you tried launching from the shortcut inside your installation folder? It should be in the following directory:
> 
> It should be either the Lol Client or the lol.admin.launcher.exe file. Try either and let me know if it worked.

The Lol client alpha didnt work from starting from this folder. and the lol.admin.launcher takes me to the legacy client.

edit: seems like after i did the league client alpha (It opened last night so i could download it) it corrupted files on the legacy client

You may need to complete a full clean reinstallation of League in order to resolve this entirely. I'd recommend following [this guide](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/202539040-Reinstalling-League-of-Legends) to see if it causes any change.

Let me know the results.

> [{quoted}](name=Targons Blade,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=sqcNJ7Qt,comment-id=000000000000,timestamp=2016-11-15T22:27:57.861+0000)
>
> You may need to complete a full clean reinstallation of League in order to resolve this entirely. I'd recommend following [this guide](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/202539040-Reinstalling-League-of-Legends) to see if it causes any change.
> 
> Let me know the results.

Actually, i found a wierd solution that kinda surprised me when it worked, i just open the legacy client and Client alpha at the same time the select no to the pop-up
I have been having the same issue and it seems the only solution is to restart my pc. It constantly says there is another client in the background running.
